Our Robot

Challenge

In the Onshape Robots to the Rescue Competition, all entering teams needed to identify a prevalent global issue and then use CAD (Computer Aided Design) to design a robot that would solve this problem. The issue we chose to focus on is that hospitals need a better system to deliver medicine to patients. Currently, nurses need to do that, and every time they must wear a new mask, gown, gloves, etc. Therefore, our robot would increase hygiene and reduce the need for PPE. We're proud of our robot's design and efficiency with solving the problem, especially considering this was our first time CADing!

Mechanisms

1. We have our chassis (shown in Diagram 1), for which we have used a gear drive (for stability) and mecanum wheels (for agility).

2. Our rack and pinion lift mechanism allows the robot to reach the height of a patient's table, in order to efficiently deliver their medication. We decided to use a rack and pinion rather than other possible lift mechanisms, such as extrusion rods or drawer slides, due to its simple and more stable design.

3. Our arm loosely appears to look like a Z shape, as it is connected to the rack and pinion mechanism at the top, and holds our custom mechanism to hold the medication snugly at the bottom. This is highlighted in Diagram 3.

4. Next, is the mechanism which holds and releases the medication. To place the medication in, someone must simply use the servo to open up the top of the mechanism attached to the arm, put the medicine inside, and close the top using the servo. The orientation at which this may be done is shown in Diagram 3. Once the robot’s arm is in position to deliver the medicine, one must use the servo to open up the mechanism, allow the medicine to drop onto the table, and then use the servo to close the mechanism back up. The orientation is shown in Diagram 2.

5. We have a camera mounted at the bottom of the drivetrain frame, which can be shown in Diagram 1. In the hospital, there would be black tape that would lead the robot to the patient’s bedside table, and the robot would be programmed autonomously to use the camera to follow along using that.

Diagram 1: Chassis

Diagram 2: Delivering Position

Diagram 3: Loading Medications Position
